snippet: Health care spending and employment have been down, hurting the recovery.
abstract: News analysis; health care spending and employment have been down and are imposing a drag on the United States economy, in contrast to the way health care sector has repeatedly helped pull the economy from recession in recent decades; reasons for slowdown are not easy to see but the consequences are--lower health care spending is not helping the economy to heal.
lead_paragraph: Health care spending and employment have been down, hurting the recovery.

headline.main: Will Saving on Health Care Hurt the Economy?
headline.print_headline: Will Saving on Health Care Hurt the Economy?

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
